Thanks for the below Kaisa!  I added a summation to 
http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#using_heritrix.
St.Ack

Kaisa Kaunonen wrote:

>
> Hello,
> here's some information from the Finnish National Library.
>
> In April 2004 we collected, as a test, web pages from 15 major Finnish
> museum sites.
>
> In June 2004 all Finnish web pages relating to the election of
> European parliament were crawled.
>
> During autumn 2004 our library crawled domains and subdomains
> belonging to Finnish universities (excluding all polytechnic
> institutions).
>
> The university tour was our main job with Heritrix that year, and
> here's info on that.
>
> * University of Helsinki : about 1.1 million URIs
> * Other general field universities (excluding Helsinki U): about 2.2
> million URIs
> * Technical universities: about 0.5 million URis
> * Unis specializing in economics: about 150 000 URIs
> * Unis specializing in arts (music, visual arts, design, theatre):
> about 200 000 URIs
>
> We could have collected with Heritrix Much & More stuff from these
> sites but decided to left out certain types of material, for example
> these
>
> * Technical faculties and departments present their projects, thesis
> and other publications on the web. Sometimes these contain links to
> extensive collections of numerical data which is needed to verify
> research results. We left out this numerical data.
> * Electronic catalog entries from univerity libraries.
> * Various web calendars
>
> Crawling was made with heritrix 1.2 or earlier. Most was done in
> domain mode which turned out to be useful in university environment
> where faculties and departments tend to have numerous subdomains.
>
> Only technical universities were crawled with host scope, in order to
> keep an eye on what kind of data Heritrix was retrieving (the
> numerical research data I mentioned).
>
> In 2005 we could try crawling the entire Finnish web space with
> Heritrix. There's no exact knowledge about the number of Finnish
> domains but one estimate is about 80 000-100 000.
>
> Nice if somebody manages to compress this info into a couple of
> sentences in Heritrix pages :)
>
>
> Regards to all there,
> Kaisa Kaunonen
> Finnish National Library
>
>
>
>
